docs.title: WARScribe Core
docs.text:
The canonical notation engine for Warhammer game actions.

WARScribe Core provides a human-readable, machine-parseable format for recording gameplay actions. Map units to IDs, record moves, and generate match transcripts.

!!! warning "Scope Clarification" WARScribe records actions only, not list validation. See Scope for details.

docs.title: What WARScribe Does
docs.text: ✅ In Scope ❌ Out of Scope Unit ID mapping Point limits Action notation Legality checks Transcript generation Loadout rules

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/WARScribe-Core.git

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
from warscribe import ActionLog

log = ActionLog()
log.register("Captain", "CPT-01")
log.record("[MOVE: CPT-01 -> Zone-A]")

docs.title: Unit Registration
docs.text:
from warscribe import ActionLog

log = ActionLog()
log.register(unit="Captain in Gravis Armour", id="CPT-01")
log.register(unit="Tactical Squad", id="TAC-01")

docs.title: Recording Actions
docs.text:
log.record("[MOVE: CPT-01 -> Zone-A]")
log.record("[SHOOT: TAC-01 -> Enemy-01]")
log.record("[CHARGE: CPT-01 -> Enemy-HQ]")

docs.title: Generate Transcript
docs.text: print(log.transcript())

docs.title: Action Types
docs.text: Action Format Move [MOVE: UnitID -> Location] Shoot [SHOOT: UnitID -> TargetID] Charge [CHARGE: UnitID -> TargetID] Fight [FIGHT: UnitID -> TargetID]

docs.title: Results
docs.text:
[SHOOT: TAC-01 -> Enemy-01, Result: 3 wounds]
[CHARGE: CPT-01 -> Enemy-HQ, Success]

docs.title: Full Transcript
docs.text:
=== Turn 1 ===
[MOVE: CPT-01 -> Zone-A]
[SHOOT: TNK-02 -> Enemy-01, Result: 3 wounds]

=== Turn 2 ===
[CHARGE: TAC-03 -> OBJ-1, Success]

docs.title: What WARScribe IS
docs.text: WARScribe is an action notation system: - Maps unit names to short IDs - Records gameplay actions in structured format - Generates machine-readable match transcripts

docs.title: What WARScribe IS NOT
docs.text:
WARScribe does not validate army lists: - No point limit checking - No detachment legality - No loadout rule enforcement

!!! info "Accepted Risk" Lists may declare units that are mechanically illegal. Future projects needing list validation require a separate validation layer. This is a documented open risk.

docs.title: Why This Scope?
docs.text:
• List validation is complex and game-version dependent
  • Action notation is stable across editions
  • Keeps the core library focused and maintainable
